result.execSummary:
The defendant Brittany A. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample (unless previously provided) & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
Spend 6 months in the county jail, commencing 10/26/19 @ 6pm.  Huber privileges are allowed.  Credit for 3 days served.  May not have contact with Jamie Feltner or Becky Hull, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

timeConds.notes: Huber privileges are allowed.  Credit for 3 days served.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of Probation Imposed by the Judge.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Victim present and addressed. Statement by Becky H. Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 2 years w/conditions; 6 months conditional jail w/Huber privileges; credit for 3 days served; deft to report to jail on 10/26/19 at 6pm; pay $250 DNA surcharge; bond applied to costs. No contact with Jamie F. or Becky H. 10/23/19 NOTE:  Pay advocate counsel bill is also a condition of probation.hb.
Guilty.
Exhibits 1 through 7 inventoried and stored in exhibit room on 8/23/19. To be destroyed after retention period. vm
for destruction of exhibits.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Day 2. State rests. Atty Koesser moves for directed verdict. Court denies motion for reasons set forth on the record. Testimony continues with:  Brittany B., Crystal H. Defense rests. Rebuttal witness:  Becky H. Jury instruction conference held off the record. Jury instructions given. Closing arguments. Alternate juror is #253, excused at 1:13pm. Jurors deliberate at 1:17pm. Verdicts reached at 3:35pm. Jury finds deft guilty. Jurors are polled. Jurors excused at 3:49pm. Court enters judgment on the verdict. PSI ordered. DNA sample ordered. SEH set for 10/23/19 at 11am. Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. On State's motion the enhancer use of a dangerous weapon is struck. Witnesses are sequestered. Jurors sworn and preliminary instructions given. Opening statements given. Testimony taken from:  Jamie F., Becky H., Carolyn G. Jurors are excused at 11:22am. Atty Koesser moves for mistrial. Court denies motion for mistrial for reasons set forth on the record. JT continued to 8/21/19 at 9am. Bond continued.
Juror selection and peremptory challenges.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Ludwig hearing held. Jury selection and voir dire completed at 10:24am. Jurors excused. Trial to commence 8/20/19 at 9am. Bond continued.

01:24 PM  Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Hans Koesser.  Clerk - CJ.
MINUTES: ADA McNeill states case is not resolved; to remain set for trial. Jury selection set for 8/19/19 at 8:30.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Case is not resolved. JSH set for 8/15/19 at 1:15pm and JS on 8/19/19 at 8:30am. Court instructs deft to catch up on attorneys fees and make payments on a regular basis. Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Koesser states that a DPA has been offered that the deft wants time to consider. STC continued to 4/18/19 at 10am. Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. ADA McNeill states that restitution was set at $0; states there is an offer for a HOA. STC continued to 3/29/19 at 9am. Bond continued.

10:26 AM  Attorney Margaret M Drees appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  No appearance by DE, Atty Koesser or victim.   Atty Drees has no explanation as to why the victim is not here who had notice from DA of today's hearing.  Court denies restitution and sets amount at $0 (zero).
email correspondence with date set for restitution hearing with Atty Koesser, DA and Victim Witness
State's Amended List of Witnesses and Demand for Discovery - filed by ADA, Carli McNeill  kmk

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Victim present. Case set for jury selection. ADA McNeill states they believe resolution would be encouraged if there is a restitution determination; requests a restitution hearing. Atty Koesser states he was prepared to proceed today; agrees that deft wants time to consider resolution. Restitution hearing to be scheduled before Commissioner Keating. STC set for 3/6/19 at 8:45am. Bond continued.
NO RECORD MADE. Attorney Emily Trigg appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. Case remains set for trial. Bond continued.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H. Koesser.  Clerk - C. Kreier. Case set for JS. State moves to adjourn JS as they are waiting for medical records. Atty Koesser moves to dismiss. Court denies motion to dismiss and grants adjournment of JS to 1/22/19 at 8:30 am - pick and go. JSH set for 11/20/18 at 1:15 pm. Bond continued.

Attorney Jennifer Phan appeared for the State. Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney H Koesser. Clerk/H. Barnett. ADA Phan states the parties have been in discussions and the case may resolve. FPT continued to 5/18/18 at 8:45am. Bond continued.

No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
